feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 1:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak And Kobuk Valleys... The Kobuk and Noatak Valleys have had 3 to 5 inches of rain so far this week, with up to another half an inch of rain expected through today. This is producing sharp rises on all rivers and streams in the Noatak and Kobuk Basins that will continue through the weekend. Large rivers such as the Kobuk and Noatak will rise
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 8:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Diminishing By This Afternoon... South winds of 15 to 25 mph will diminish through the morning with receding surge and decreasing wave action along the coast. Wave action is combining with storm surge to inundate some low lying areas, and push water above the normal High Tide Line this morning. South facing coastlines have seen storm surge values of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 12:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated river levels will continue into the weekend. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:11AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog possible for portions of the Tennessee Valley... Patchy Dense Fog has developed, especially in some area river valleys, with visibility dropping to 1/4 mile or less. The fog will likely become a bit more prevalent in these areas before sunrise. Motorists are urged to drive with extreme caution, as visibility
entry.cap:areaDesc: Colbert; Cullman; DeKalb; Franklin; Jackson; Lauderdale; Lawrence; Limestone; Madison; Marshall; Morgan

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 26 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH MONDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has extended an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 4:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF MORNING FOG... Fog will impact inland northeast Florida and parts of southeast Georgia through sunrise, especially along and near the Interstate 10 corridor from Jacksonville to Live Oak and areas west of Highway 301 from Ocala to Hilliard. Visibility will fall below 1 mile at times.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 2:26AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Fog will continue to develop this morning, and the fog may be locally dense at times through 9 AM EDT. Motorists should be prepared for rapid changes in visibilities across short distances early this morning due to the patchy nature of the fog. entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog to Start the Morning... Areas of dense fog have developed across eastern Kentucky.
